poem.body:
How lonesome the Wind must feel Nights - When People have put out the Lights And everything that has an Inn Closes his/the shutter and goes in -
How pompous the Wind must feel Noons Stepping to incorporeal Tunes Correcting errors of the sky And clarifying scenery
How mighty the Wind must feel Morns Encamping on a thousand dawns Espousing each and spurning all Then soaring to his Turret/Temple Tall -
